title.label: BEST GAME ON THE APP STORE!

content.label:
I know what your thinking. Looks cool- but is it worth it? 

Let me walk you through my average day in stardew valley. 

I wake up to a rooster crow. Feed the animals and water the plants. Head into town to chat and buy some groceries, maybe surprise a friend with a gift! Then I head into the mines for some stone and ores. Then I head back for some dinner, and relax, watch some TV. It‚Äôs a fun game- don‚Äôt wait! It‚Äôs relaxing, fun, and really makes your day.

Thanks ConcernedApe for making this game so awesome!!!!!üëçüéâ

title.label: Love it, I give it my thanks,

content.label:
I live on a real farm in real life... and it was to my discovery that this game has seemed to stand the test of time, lessons and morals, along with beautiful sadness that touches the heart and soul. loving and all... it is just a game, and that is what is good about it... it is unlike any other game you can find, even better than the ripoffs. It is truly the best of the best! 

Yours truly: R.B.Vangemert otherwise known as GawdMydiniumP

title.label: Best game ever, just one thing

This is a strange request, but I think it should be possible to transfer money and resources from one world to another. Basically it‚Äôs if you could trade with others.

This is one of the best games I‚Äôve ever played. I love the grinding, the dialogue, I basically love everything about this game. The only thing that makes me disappointed is that there‚Äôs no multiplayer. I really want to be able to play with my friends but sadly I can‚Äôt. I was wondering if you guys will eventually add multiplayer.

I absolutely love this game. Originally I played the pc version and loved it, though of course I want something I can relax with and play on the go, was really excited to see it on the App Store and I‚Äôm getting just as much enjoyment. The slight changes to optimize the game for tablets and phones I feel actually improve it, like scanning the camera around the town to look for fishing hot spots and items to pick up. I would definitely recommend this game to anyone who just wants a nice relaxing game to chill out to, or people who are strategists, as there‚Äôs a lot you can do, like mining, fighting monsters, fishing, building relationships, and of course the farming which you can also be more strategic about. The story is also nice and cute with depth that you don‚Äôt really get with other mobile games.

title.label: Great game but has some issues

content.label:
I‚Äôve owned Stardew Valley for PC for several years and I love the game, which is why I‚Äôm giving it three stars, otherwise if I didn‚Äôt already know it‚Äôs such an awesome game it would receive one star for how many bugs I‚Äôve encountered. 

I‚Äôm on an iPhone 12 pro with iOS 14.2, 230GB of storage left. The game randomly freezes up, my character is completely unresponsive to controls, if I leave it then it will go back to normal within a few seconds. My character randomly picked up the TV in my house when I was walking past it, and now is unable to set the TV back down. Even if I walk into the middle of the room with no obstacles and the outline is green, I can‚Äôt place it down. So now my inventory slot is taken up by a TV and I can‚Äôt check the forecast for my luck each day. When planting seeds there seems to be some sort of glitch where instead of planting them in the green box that tells you where you‚Äôre going to set/plant something it plants them randomly somewhere outside of the box, so planting straight rows of crops has become rather tricky. When using the controls with invisible joystick and one or two invisible buttons, the game thinks I‚Äôm zooming in or out when walking around and will randomly zoom in and out. Sometimes when the game freezes it repeatedly scrolls through my inventory very quickly until it becomes responsive again. I‚Äôve also found some controls to just not work at all, and some things are completely hidden because the screen has cut them off. 

Really disappointing since I‚Äôm a big fan of the PC version, I was looking forward to having it with me on the go. I‚Äôll update this review if and when the bugs are ironed out.

title.label: Would love to rate higher, but CRASHES

content.label: Saw other reviews about this app crashing, figured I‚Äôd give it a shot anyway - for the first year no issues whatsoever and I loved it! End of second spring with more and more happening in the game, the crashes started. Not sure if overload of things in the app or what, but it‚Äôs gotten to the point where I plan out my days with very little tasks just in case it crashes. Almost unplayable. PLEASE fix..
I cannot wait until my first grade granddaughter can read well enough to play this. She will absolutely love it as much as I do. It is for all ages.

I have this game on every platform available and this version was definitely worth the purchase again. It runs soOO smooth on my iPad and it is the perfect game to play when you‚Äôre wanting to pass the time. I‚Äôve run into no bugs so far and I love that you can pick up where you left off. This game is made and updated by one guy so definitely look into getting this on other platforms if you  love it on iOS!!

This basically makes it unplayable. I‚Äôll change my review back to 5 stars if this gets fixed

Stardew Valley really shined a light on role playing games. I‚Äôve enjoyed every second I played the game. All 772,523 seconds of game time so far. If you are looking for a game that is well worth your money and time, then Stardew Valley is the game for you. There isn‚Äôt a ‚Äúendgame‚Äù per say, so that means endless farming fun. Farm,Fish, Mine, Forage,Fight,Make Relationships and start a Family. Stardew Valley is the perfect place away from reality.
